ygData.subject: RE: [Re: Somethin seems wrong (long response)]
ygData.msgSnippet: There is one little fact that everyone is overlooking... There can be no monopoly because anyone who is willing to invest some time and money can learn this
ygData.messageBody:
There is one little fact that everyone is overlooking...

There can be no monopoly because anyone who is willing to invest some time
and money can learn this skill.

Sicne we can't control who gets pieces of ore or sketches, we really have no
power, in so far as monopolies are concerned.

I say raise prices and anyone who doesn't want to pay can make their own.

Graedon

-----Original Message-----
From: Nick Emmerich [mailto:seorin@...]
Sent: Monday, July 12, 1999 1:36 PM
To: EQ_Blacksmiths@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [Re: [EQ_Blacksmiths] Somethin seems wrong (long response)]


From: Nick Emmerich <seorin@...>

I'm american. That doesn't make me against this price war :) Laws were
established against
collusion and monopolies to prevent the abuse of the abilities they granted.
It was proven
that people who practiced either concept would abuse the ability (i.e. JD
Rockefeller and
Standard Oil). There is no law in EQ saying we can't practice these concepts
or even one
saying we can't abuse them. We could be jerks and charge just as much as
chain. If we all
agree to it, they have no choice do they?
